author: Mivici

review: [this device replaces an Apple TV version 2 and the review is based on that]we use this primarily to watch netflix and for the ken burns slideshow (as we have a wired house, and our best travel pictures setup for apple photoshare); the quality of the pictures (taken mostly with real cameras, ie. rebel, nikon P series, not iphones) is noticeably better; so much so that I have found myself watching it for quite a long time, since on a big flat screen, there's quite alot of depth to see, asnd I am truly seeing things in the photos that I have never seen before.as for the netflix support, it seems a bit better than it used to be, especially in the stopping/starting functionality. SWMBO watches her Bones on it, and the HD episodes seem very sharp and without pixellation or such problems as that (we also have a ROKU, just to be safe, so I do have something to compare this to; I've always thought the ROKU streams better than the Apple, but not so sure with this new ATV3; of course, as for the interface, there's no comparison, but i don't have time to go into that).
author: rompers uncle

review: I bought this unit primarily to access Netflix and Amazon Prime  (using Airplay).  It works great for both.  The Apple TV interface for Netflix is much better than the one provided with my LG Blu-ray player and streaming is more reliable.  It is also great for viewing your photo library on TV and accessing music on your networked computer with iTunes.  With Airplay you can mirror on your TV pretty much anything you can display on your iPad or iPhone and it works great.  There are quite a few other supported services and features that I have not used.  Using just one of the supported services would justify the purchase.
